extends Object
    File utilities.

    • Method Detail

      • copyFileFromResource

        public static boolean copyFileFromResource(File destinationFile,
                                           String resourcePath)
        Copy a resource file (from the JAR) to the given file if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        destinationFile - The file to check and copy to (outside of JAR)
        resourcePath - Local path to the resource file (path to file within JAR)
        Returns:
        False if the file does not exist and could not be copied, true otherwise

      • createDirectory

        public static boolean createDirectory(File dir)
        Creates the given directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to create
        Returns:
        true upon success, false otherwise

      • getResourceFromJar

        public static InputStream getResourceFromJar(String path)
        Returns a JAR file as stream. Returns null if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        path - the local path (starting from resources project, e.g. "config.yml" for 'resources/config.yml')
        Returns:
        the stream if the file exists, or false otherwise

      • purgeDirectory

        public static void purgeDirectory(File directory)
        Delete a given directory and all its content.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to remove

      • delete

        public static void delete(File file)
        Delete the given file or directory and log a message if it was unsuccessful. Method is null safe and does nothing when null is passed.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to delete

      • create

        public static void create(File file)
        Creates the given file or throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to create

      • makePath

        public static String makePath(String... elements)
        Construct a file path from the given elements, i.e. separate the given elements by the file separator.
        Parameters:
        elements - The elements to create a path with
        Returns:
        The created path

      • createCurrentTimeString

        public static String createCurrentTimeString()
        Creates a textual representation of the current time (including minutes), e.g. useful for automatically generated backup files.
        Returns:
        string of the current time for use in file names

      • createBackupFilePath

        public static String createBackupFilePath(File file)
        Returns a path to a new file (which doesn't exist yet) with a timestamp in the name in the same folder as the given file and containing the given file's filename.
        Parameters:
        file - the file based on which a new file path should be created
        Returns:
        path to a file suitably named for storing a backup
